title: Testing Infrastructure Improvements Epic
description:
Improve testing infrastructure to catch API compatibility issues before release.

## Problem
The zone list command failed in production because:
1. Mock test data didn't match real API responses
2. Tests used "happy path" data with all fields populated
3. Real API returns null for optional fields (owner.id, original_name_servers)
4. No tests verify actual API response structure

## Root Cause Analysis
- `create_zone_json()` in tests always returns non-null values
- Real Cloudflare API returns: `"original_name_servers": null`, `"owner": {"id": null, ...}`
- Serde deserialization failed on null values for non-Option fields

## Goals
1. Add realistic API response fixtures
2. Test edge cases (null fields, missing fields, extra fields)
3. Add CLI integration tests that test actual command execution
4. Consider contract testing against Cloudflare API schemas

title: Capture real API responses for fixtures
description: Run cfad commands against real Cloudflare API and capture raw JSON responses. Save to tests/fixtures/ directory. Include: zone list response with null fields, D1/R2 responses, error responses (401, 403, 404).

title: Update wiremock mocks to use real fixtures
description: Replace create_zone_json() and similar mock helpers with fixtures loaded from tests/fixtures/. Ensure null values and edge cases are preserved in mocks.

title: Add CLI binary tests with assert_cmd
description: Add tests/cli/ directory with tests that run the cfad binary. Test: all subcommands recognized, --help works, invalid args produce errors, missing required args caught. Re-add assert_cmd and predicates dev dependencies.

title: Add src/cli/token.rs CLI commands
description: Define CLI subcommands for token management: TokenCommand enum with List, Show, Create, Update, Delete, Verify, Permissions variants. Use clap derives with appropriate arguments and help text.

title: Realistic API Response Fixtures
description: Create test fixtures that match real Cloudflare API responses including null fields, edge cases, and varying response formats. Capture real API responses to use as test data. Ensures integration tests catch deserialization issues.

title: Add src/api/token.rs API models
description: Create API models for Cloudflare Token API: Token, TokenPolicy, PermissionGroup structs. Include serde derives for JSON serialization. Model fields: id, name, status, not_before, expires_on, issued_on, modified_on, last_used_on, policies array.

title: API Token Management Epic
description:
Implement comprehensive API token management for cfad CLI.

## Background
Currently users must manage API tokens through the Cloudflare web dashboard.
Adding CLI support enables automation and easier token lifecycle management.

## Cloudflare API Endpoints
- GET /user/tokens - List tokens
- POST /user/tokens - Create token
- GET /user/tokens/:id - Get token
- PUT /user/tokens/:id - Update token
- DELETE /user/tokens/:id - Delete token
- GET /user/tokens/verify - Verify current token
- GET /user/tokens/permission_groups - List available permissions

## Required Permissions
Token must have "API Tokens Read" and/or "API Tokens Write" permissions.

title: Null Field Handling Tests

description: Add unit tests in each api/*.rs file that test deserialization from raw JSON strings. Test: null fields, missing optional fields, unexpected extra fields. Example: test_zone_deserialize_with_null_owner_id().

title: Error Response Tests
description: Add tests for Cloudflare API error responses: 401 unauthorized, 403 forbidden, 404 not found, 429 rate limited, 500 server errors. Ensure error messages are user-friendly and actionable.

title: CLI Integration Tests
description: Add integration tests that exercise the actual CLI binary with all command options. Test: subcommand recognition, flag parsing, required vs optional args, error messages. Use assert_cmd or similar to test cfad binary directly.

title: Token Create Command
description: Implement 'cfad token create' command to create new API tokens. Options: --name, --policies (JSON or interactive), --expires, --not-before. Uses POST /user/tokens endpoint. Should support permission group selection.

title: Token Permissions Command
description: Implement 'cfad token permissions' command to list all available permission groups. Uses GET /user/tokens/permission_groups endpoint. Should categorize by scope (account, zone, user) and show permission group IDs for use in token creation.

title: Add src/ops/token.rs operations
description: Implement token operation functions: list_tokens(), get_token(), create_token(), update_token(), delete_token(), verify_token(), list_permission_groups(). Each function calls CloudflareClient with appropriate endpoint.

- POST /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs - Create migration job

- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/abort - Abort specific job
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/pause - Pause job
- PUT /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/resume - Resume job

- GET /accounts/{account_id}/slurper/jobs/{job_id}/logs - Get job logs

## CLI Commands
- cfad r2 migrate check-source --provider <aws|gcs|azure> --credentials <...> - Verify source

- cfad r2 migrate show <job-id> - Show job details
